discussion.content:
A and D? 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/firmware-mgmt/cli/2-2/b_CLI_Firmware_Management_22/b_CLI_Firmware_Management_22_chapter_0101.html
Automatic Internal Backup

While the Infrastructure firmware is being upgraded, an automatic full state backup file is created. Cisco UCS Manager Release 2.2(4) introduces two new backup stages that are visible in the FSM status. These are:
 InternalBackup—Backs up the configuration.
 PollInternalBackup—Waits for the backup to complete. 


Both appear in the Equipment > Fimware Management > Firmware Auto Install > FSM > Step Sequence

questions.question_text: After upgrading a client's fabric interconnect to the latest version, an engineer discovers that the appliance has lost its entire configuration. Which two locations should an engineer check to confirm that the appliance had backed up the configuration prior to the upgrade in order to retrieve the lost configuration? (Choose two.)
The external routes fail to propagate to leaf switches in Cisco ACI fabric. Which two actions resolve the issue? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Assign an MP-BGP AS number to the fabric.
choices.D: Associate the correct contract to the L3Out.
choices.C: Specify the spine nodes as route reflectors.
choices.A: Enable the VTEP pool in the fabric.

discussion.content:
C and D. 
To enable the exchange of external routes between the L3Out and the internal fabric, you should make sure that the correct contract is associated with the L3Out. This contract should permit the necessary external routes to be shared.

Options A, B, and E are not directly related to the issue of external routes failing to propagate to leaf switches:

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. One of the vPC VTEPs fails to route VXLAN traffic to vPC connected hosts. When the issue was being diagnosed, it was discovered that the packets that were expected to be forwarded to the MAC address on the SWITCH-VTEP-1 are instead forwarded to the MAC address on SWITCH-VTEP-2 and then dropped. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.D: Configure a different secondary IP address for one of the vPC peers
choices.C: Configure peer-gateway under the VPC domain on both peers
choices.A: Configure a distributed anycast gateway on both peers
choices.B: Configure ip arp synchronize under the VPC domain on both peers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"it was discovered that the packets that were expected to be forwarded to the MAC address on the SWITCH-VTEP-1 are instead forwarded to the MAC address on SWITCH-VTEP-2 and then dropped"

common issue with no peer-gateway. seems answer is C.

choices.C: Use a filter list for OSPF to filter both routes
choices.A: Change the administrative distance of OSPF to 220
choices.B: Configure the route as a BGP backdoor

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The ip 209.165.200.226 is internal BGP, its AD is 200.
From "show ip route 209.165.200.226", its distance(AD) is 110. (OSPF)

In conclusion, because of OSPF (lower AD), BGP RIB failure happens.
So correct answer would be A...I think.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A customer network uses OSPFv2 and MP-BGP protocols. A network administrator installs a new Cisco Nexus Switch in the data center but experiences a BGP RIB failure. Which action solves the issue?

An engineer is implementing a new BGP peering in their new data center. The engineer set up the BGP session that peers with the remote end. As soon as the BGP peers attempt to exchange routing prefixes, one of the BGP peers drops the connection. After reviewing the configuration, the engineer reviews the logging messages. The engineer discovers that the router is missing keepalives from the remote end and terminates the session. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I would say A

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/116377-troubleshoot-bgp-mtu.html

choices.A: Set the bgp transport path-mtu-discovery attribute on both peers
choices.B: Set the higher values for the BGP keepalive and hold-down timers on both peers
choices.C: Configure the matching BGP AS numbers between the peers
choices.D: Configure the matching BGP passwords between the peers
